title: Promising Cryptos to Watch Right Now
keyQuestions: Why do some crypto assets outperform across cycles while others fade?
What’s the simplest framework to evaluate a token beyond hype and narratives?
Which core networks tend to matter most for long-run infrastructure demand?
How do you manage risk when exploring smaller or newer assets?
What checklist helps you avoid common operational and custody mistakes?
quickSteps: Start with fundamentals: problem–solution fit, security, and real user demand.
Check token economics: supply schedule, utility, and dilution risks.
Look for ecosystem strength: developers, tooling, integrations, and liquidity.
Size positions using a risk budget; avoid leverage unless you fully understand liquidation risk.
Use strong custody hygiene: hardware wallets for long-term holds, test recovery, and keep clean backups.

issueRouting.start: Pick a thesis first (store of value, smart-contract platform, high-throughput apps, interoperability, or infrastructure). Then select assets that best express that thesis with clear risk controls.

branches.if: You want the most resilient core exposure
then: Keep the majority in high-liquidity, widely adopted networks.
Use rules-based DCA and rebalancing instead of headline-driven trading.

branches.if: You want higher beta exposure to emerging narratives
then: Limit sizing and demand evidence of organic usage, not just incentives.
Verify liquidity and custody options before taking meaningful exposure.

branches.if: You’re worried about security and operational mistakes
then: Separate hot funds from cold storage, and test small transfers first.
Double-check networks and addresses to avoid wrong-chain losses.

riskNotes: Crypto is highly volatile; position sizing and time horizon matter more than perfect entry timing.
Regulatory and issuer-level controls can affect access and liquidity in edge cases; diversify venues and workflows.
Most avoidable losses come from operational errors: wrong network, bad addresses, or weak custody hygiene.
